content: tall if using new yarn for border fasten_off if not continue to border border now you re adding a single_crochet border to your mat i like to use a contrasting color of plarn for my border but this is all per- sonal preference if attaching a new ball join at a corner with a slip_stitch then chain 1 if working with the same ball it will already be attached work 3 single_crochet into the starting corner then work around in single_crochet placing one single_crochet in each st and row and 3 single_crochet in each corner when you make it all the way around join to the beginning of the border with a slip_stitch fasten_off and weave in ends i like to weave in ends with my fingers weaving the ends through the stitches then i secure with a knot and trim the end straps make 2 you may use caution tape or other similar stronger material to make the straps if you wish if you do i find that a chain is plenty strong enough to support the mat if using plarn you will need to do the next round to reinforce it to make it strong enough both materials work equally well in the end chain until chain measures roughly 60 in 150 cm estimation tip this is roughly the length of an adult wingspan 1sc in second chain from hook and 1 single_crochet in each st to end 2 more single_crochet in last chain rotate work we are now working around the chain in the round working on the other side of the chain place 1 single_crochet in each chain to end place 1 more single_crochet in final chain then join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet fasten_off and secure ends 6 full-length crochet instructions continued strap placement when the mat is folded in half straps should be placed 1/3 of the mat s distance away from each edge straps are attached to only one layer of mat strap attachment method 1 this method works best with skinnier straps that fit through the mat easily and tie in a knot securely loop the straps through the spaces between the single_crochet stitches in the mat several row down from the edge tie the straps in a knot being careful not to wrinkle the mat too much in the process this was my go-to method for awhile as it is easier strap attachment method 2 i use this method for thicker straps that cannot be attached with method 1 fold straps in half and align with top edge of mat following strap placement attach plarn to mat wit a slip_stitch and a chain 1 make several single_crochet into the mat crocheting over the strap you may wish to go back and forth several times for added security this method is more difficult and time-consuming but works much
